title: User can request for password reset link without giving his website, eventhough he have it
vulnerability_information:
Hi,
I found that , when a user ask for password reset  at https://www.cloudflare.com/login
He need to give his email address as well as one of the sites if he have .
But your site is sending  password reset link to the user who have added  websites to his account , but not entering any one of the name while requesting for password reset.
Iam able to password reset eventhough , i have added a website to my account.
I found this so, i reported.
Sorry, if this an intentional design  from your side .
Thanks and regards
Haji

activities.message:
Hi,

Thanks for your report.

Can you please provide exact steps to duplicate this? I am not able to duplicate what you're reporting at this time.

Thanks!

Hi,
First see this  https://www.cloudflare.com/forgot-password
Here your site has given this information. 
(To reset your password, enter your email address and one website that you have signed up. If you haven't signed any websites up yet, leave the field blank. We'll send you an email with instructions of what to do next.)
From this it is clear that to ask for password reset link user has to enter 
a) Email address ,  b) One of the website (if present in the account).
Consider two situations now
Case 1 :
User has not added any website to his account.
Here he can just ask for password reset link by entering only email address. No need for website.

Case 2 :
User has added one or more website to his account.
The bug exists in this case. As user has added a website to his account , then definately he should enter both
 a) email address , b) Website name   
for requesting password reset.
But here i observed that eventhough user has added any website to his account ,  He can just leave (one of websites) field , for requesting password reset link.

Now you can see that  there is no difference between both the cases for asking password reset .
As a result security flaw exist in this particular place.

My point here is to draw your attention towards  "Case 2 ".
If a user has added any website to his account , then definately he should enter both the fields to ask for password reset, other wise there will be no security in this particular field.

Fix:
Make both the fields [  a) email address  ,   b) Website name ]  mandatory for password reset once a user has added one or more of the websites to his account

If any further information required , please let me know.
Thanks and regards
Haji

Hi,

I don't quite follow the issue with case 2 -- where a user has a domain in their account already.  It's not possible to do a forgot password reset WITHOUT entering a domain if you already have a domain in your account. I've confirmed this is indeed the case.  So I'm not following what you're indicating is the specific issue, that field already is required in case 2 if the use already has a domain in their account.

Thanks.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Login to https://www.cloudfare.com/login
and add a website like this  http://prntscr.com/4ept15  in your account.
2) Logout and go to  https://www.cloudflare.com/forgot-password  .
3) Enter only email address like this  http://prntscr.com/4eptwi   and the request will be processed like this http://prntscr.com/4epued and you will get reset link at the email address.
This part is completed.
4) And  password reset link asked by entering both the fields as well like this
 http://prntscr.com/4epvvi
is  working fine. But the bug exists as illustrated in above 3 steps.
So, by not entering any website name , user can still ask for password reset , eventhough he have website added in his account.

Regards
Haji

Hi,

The domain in the account is not actually active on CloudFlare yet -- which is why it's not required during the password reset step of the forgot password form.

Only validated/active domains apply when using the forgot password form.  We would not consider this to be a vulnerability as it's a design choice we've made.

Then when i enter my domain name (Which you are saying as not validated)  as well as email address
iam getting reset link.
How??
What about that?

Hi,

The form is acting as we intend it to at this time. The unverified domain is not required yet since it is not fully activated in the account. At that point it's considered optional. If you supply it then it will be accepted, but since the domain is not verified yet it's not a required value.
